ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: different types of research methods, biases/problems that researchers encounter, how to conduct a literature review, structure of a research paper
How to evaluate research and be a more cautious reader of research claims, particularly within the context of diverse samples
research methods at all steps of the psychological science process

How to conduct research, how to ensure validity, and how to evaluate results properly. This class was more useful than the stats class I took for the major because it allowed me to apply statistical tests in practice and fully understand it. I learned a lot!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: it feels very hands on, you get to work closely with your professor and classmates, feedback is immediate and very detailed so you know exactly where things went wrong. A lot of guidance. The schedule of this course was also constantly adjusted based on what we were able to get through in class; everything felt very structured without being inflexible.
Weaknesses: none
Lot of good feedback along the way and the research process was broken down into different parts so it felt manageable to consume all the information and build on each other

Strengths: teaching team, range of assignments, organization, ability to receive feedback of drafts
Weaknesses: last project was rushed/timeline was off

really passionate instructors, i just feel like the grading/assignment assigning timeline and schedule was a bit disorganized and i didnt always leave class knowing what i needed to work on next and where to start, maybe this content is good to teach in more of a 1.5 credit, lab oriented setting as opposed to just 2x a week meeting
The communication between the professor and students was a little slow, but otherwise it was well organized, we received a lot of feedback, it was great!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes; you're probably taking this because it's required, but even if you do not ever do real scientific research, learning the essay structure and biases in publications is still very useful
Yes. It really does give you a good overview of the research process and you actually get to practice conducting research and designing studies which is pretty cool.
100%!! If you're a psych major, this class is perfect for you. I just wish I could've taken it earlier before I started working in my lab! These skills are really valuable.
Yes! Most useful course I have taken so far related to psychology major!
